Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kebele Kochore
Review: A multi-layered, dynamic, sweetly spice- and floral-toned coffee.

Name: El Sitio Ecuador
Review: A lovely, classic coffee from the relatively unrecognized origin of Ecuador: bright and balanced, with a sweet florality that envelopes chocolate and citrus notes.

Name: Harfusa Espresso
Review: A classic contemporary American espresso: brightly sweet and intricately aromatic.

Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Origin_String: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Name: SOPACDI Congo
Review: A particularly impressive example of the improving coffees from the Lake Kivu region Congo SOPACDI Cooperative: clean, floral, and deeply engaging in the cup.

Name: Ecuador Finca Maputo
Review: A classic Latin American cup, suavely balanced in structure, quietly complete in aromatics.

Name: Full Cycle Espresso
Review: A gently pungent, nut-toned espresso, with a plush mouthfeel and quiet nuance.

Name: Reserve Panama Geisha Hacienda La Esmeralda
Review: A gorgeous coffee for anyone who can afford it: crisply sweet, lushly floral, with deeply layered nuance. Excessive yet elegant.

Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, Hawaii
Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, Hawaii
Name: 100% Kona High Mountain Io Fancy
Review: The classic Kona cup on steroids, maybe with a hint of Kenya: sweetly and pungently berry-toned; chocolatey and floral.

Name: Kenya Grand Cru
Review: A classic Kenya cup: gently bright, juicy, crisply berry-toned.

Name: Guatemala Bella Vista
Review: A delicate, pleasantly tart Guatemala cup with brisk hints of lemon zest throughout.

Name: Sumatra Aceh
Review: A sweetly crisp roast-dominated profile complicated by a quiet under layering of fruit and chocolate.

Name: Beta Blend
Review: Rich, deep, pungent, with suggestions of blood orange.

Name: Boka Papua New Guinea
Review: Displays the engaging, sweetly pungent, grapefruit-like nuance typical of many fine Papua New Guinea coffees. Taints caused by one or two bad beans in an otherwise sound batch of coffee are difficult to predict and control. Most likely, consumers who order this coffee will not encounter a tainted cup in their particular sample.

Name: Java Sunda Hejo Microlot
Review: Zesty, sweet, gently tart. An unusual small-holder coffee from Java, an origin best known for coffees from large, government-operated estates.

Name: Rwanda Huye Mountain
Review: A gently bright, very sweet Rwanda cup, simultaneously zesty and lush.

Origin: Hambela District, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Hambela District, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Benti Nenqa Ethiopia
Review: An intricately composed wet-processed Ethiopia, crisply floral and resonantly sweet.

Name: Cueva de los Llanos Colombia
Review: A delicate, honeyish Colombia, balanced and pretty.

Name: Three Africans
Review: An engaging blend of Africa coffees, equally lively and mellow, with chocolate suggestions from nose to finish.

Name: Bolivia Finca La Linda Honey Java
Review: A coffee from an unusual origin (Bolivia) and an unusual tree variety (Java) processed by an unusual method (honey). The result is a profile that is also unusual, though quietly so: spicy and pungently nut- and fruit-toned.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Chelba
Review: The dark roast developes the pungent, spicy sandalwood, soft florals and crisp cocoa notes of this fine natural-processed Yirgacheffe.

Name: Competition Blend
Review: An engaging and dramatically complex espresso: deeply floral, vibrantly zesty, roundly nut- and chocolate-toned.

Name: Cerro San Luis Costa Rica
Review: A crisply pretty Costa Rica cup, sweet with dried fruit and rich cocoa notes throughout.

Name: Baloo Espresso
Review: A sweet but distinct tartness animates this rich, chocolaty espresso.
